name: Marv Rheingans
text_appearance: Marv is clad in the finest Harrison standard issue heavy army, not a scratch on the paint nor dent on the metal will tarnish the proud name of the Armories
history:
Marv Rheingans, 51st Mechanized Legion: Ras Shamra

Marv was born and bred on Harrison. He attended military college, where he received the training required to pilot one of the prestigious Shermans relied upon by the HA Legions. He took part in peacekeeping operations along the Dawnline Shore against Karakin forces, participated in naval raids against pirate barons, and even attended a military parade for Harrison III himself.

But it wasn’t enough. Marv felt there was more he could do outside of the Legion. He approached his officer and requested a different job assignment—one with more action. The officer offered him a position with an associate within Union, attached to a peacekeeping operation on a highly unstable world. Marv eagerly accepted, ready to spread the good word of Harrison in Union space. Sure he would loose the licence requirement to pilot his sherman, but he felt eager to work his way back up and get it all again.

weapon.flavorDescription:
Much like GMS mechs, GMS weapons are reliable galactic standards, made using interchangeable parts and built to withstand almost any conditions. There are three lines currently in production.
The Type-I (T-1) line is defined by powerful, reliable, and conventional-kinetic ranged and melee weapons, including the GMS assault rifle, heavy machine gun, shotgun, pistol, and various light and heavy blades. Reliable galactic standards, the GMS T-1 line is the most widely used mech-scale line of weaponry across the galaxy. Echoing the Everest’s design notes, T-1 weapons are simply designed, with few (if any) moving parts, intended to be used in or adaptable to any environment.

Much like GMS mechs, GMS weapons are reliable galactic standards, made using interchangeable parts and built to withstand almost any conditions. There are three lines currently in production.
The Type-III (T-3) line is made up of heavy weapons, ordnance, and other exotic, specialized, or massive weapons. A broad classification, the T-3 range includes conventional-kinetic anti-materiel rifles, super-rapid cycling pulse rifles, missile racks, cannons, and drone nexuses – “hive”style launchers that serve as miniature factory, hangar, and deployment systems for portable drones. The classification also includes the fearsome “segment knife”, a system that uses flash-printing to produce disposable edged weapons in a vicinity around the user.

armor.flavorDescription: The heaviest hardsuits. They are always powered and up-armored with thick, composite armor. Heavy hardsuits often feature integrated weapons, powerful mobility suites, and – by augmenting their user’s strength – allow their user to field much heavier weapons than normal infantry can typically carry. Heavy hardsuits are in decline now that half-size chassis are popular, but they are still common among private militaries and middle-tier Diasporan armed forces.

weapons.flavorDescription: Light signature weapons might be oversized revolvers, braces of pistols, and submachine guns.
Heavy signature weapons are missile tubes, heavy lasers, light machine gun, or exotic rifles.

gear.flavorDescription: A powerful electronic scope that provides high-resolution magnification up to two miles, and automatically adjusts its reticle for wind, gravity, and pressure. Smart scopes can project their field of vision and all data to the HUD of any networked user. They can also pair with other thermal, optical, or simulated-vision devices to further enhance targeting.

Pilot rations aren’t much better than their nautical forerunners – both are variants on hardtack and nutrient paste. Pilots often carry a stash of extra food, or luxuries like chocolate, coffee, alcohol, or preserved goods from their homeworld. These rations can be used to barter or boost morale.
